title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement paul.govan2@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Paul Govan. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Govan P (2024). PRA: Project Risk Analysis. R package version 0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PRA: Project Risk Analysis},   author = {Paul Govan},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1}, }

title: PRA: Project Risk Analysis
text: Data Analysis Project Risk Managment via Second Moment Method (SMM), Monte Carlo (MC) Simulation, Bayesian methods, Design Structure Matrices (DSMs), .

title: PRA: Project Risk Analysis
text: can install development version PRA like :
code: devtools::install_github('paulgovan/PRA')

title: PRA: Project Risk Analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem using Monte Carlo Simulation:
code: library(PRA)  num_simulations <- 10000 task_distributions <- list(   list(type = "normal", mean = 10, sd = 2),  # Task A: Normal distribution   list(type = "triangular", a = 5, b = 10, c = 15),  # Task B: Triangular distribution   list(type = "uniform", min = 8, max = 12)  # Task C: Uniform distribution ) correlation_matrix <- matrix(c(   1, 0.5, 0.3,   0.5, 1, 0.4,   0.3, 0.4, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE)  results <- mcs(num_simulations, task_distributions, correlation_matrix) cat("Mean Total Duration:", results$total_mean, "\n") #> Mean Total Duration: 38.61906 cat("Variance of Total Duration:", results$total_variance, "\n") #> Variance of Total Duration: 19.95962 hist(results$total_distribution, breaks = 50, main = "Distribution of Total Project Duration",       xlab = "Total Duration", col = "skyblue", border = "white")

title: PRA: Project Risk Analysis
text: Please note PRA project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Actual Cost (AC). — ac
text: Actual Cost (AC).

title: Actual Cost (AC). — ac
code: ac(actual_costs, time_period)

title: Actual Cost (AC). — ac
text: actual_costs Vector actual costs incurred time period. time_period Current time period.

title: Actual Cost (AC). — ac
text: function returns Actual Cost (AC) work completed.

title: Actual Cost (AC). — ac
code: actual_costs <- c(9000, 18000, 36000, 70000, 100000) time_period <- 3  ac <- ac(actual_costs, time_period) cat("Actual Cost (AC):", ac, "\n") #> Actual Cost (AC): 36000

title: Contingency Calculation. — contingency
text: Contingency Calculation.

title: Contingency Calculation. — contingency
code: contingency(sims, phigh = 0.95, pbase = 0.5)

title: Contingency Calculation. — contingency
text: sims List results Monte Carlo simulation. phigh Percentile level contingency calculation. pbase Base level contingency calculation.

title: Contingency Calculation. — contingency
text: function returns value calculated contingency.

title: Contingency Calculation. — contingency
code: num_sims <- 10000 task_dists <- list(   list(type = "normal", mean = 10, sd = 2),  # Task A: Normal distribution   list(type = "triangular", a = 5, b = 10, c = 15),  # Task B: Triangular distribution   list(type = "uniform", min = 8, max = 12)  # Task C: Uniform distribution ) cor_mat <- matrix(c(   1, 0.5, 0.3,   0.5, 1, 0.4,   0.3, 0.4, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE) results <- mcs(num_sims, task_dists, cor_mat) contingency <- contingency(results, phigh = 0.95, pbase = 0.50) cat("Contingency based on 95th percentile and 50th percentile:", contingency) #> Contingency based on 95th percentile and 50th percentile: 7.214802

title: Cost Performance Index (CPI). — cpi
text: Cost Performance Index (CPI).

title: Cost Performance Index (CPI). — cpi
code: cpi(ev, ac)

title: Cost Performance Index (CPI). — cpi
text: ev Earned Value. ac Actual Cost.

title: Cost Performance Index (CPI). — cpi
text: function returns Cost Performance Index (CPI) work completed.

title: Cost Performance Index (CPI). — cpi
code: bac <- 100000 actual_per_complete <- 0.35 ev <- ev(bac, actual_per_complete) actual_costs <- c(9000, 18000, 36000, 70000, 100000) time_period <- 3 ac <- ac(actual_costs, time_period)  cpi <- cpi(ev, ac) cat("Cost Performance Index (CPI):", cpi, "\n") #> Cost Performance Index (CPI): 0.9722222

text: ev Earned Value. ac Actual Cost.

title: Cost Variance (CV). — cv
code: bac <- 100000 actual_per_complete <- 0.35 ev <- ev(bac, actual_per_complete) actual_costs <- c(9000, 18000, 36000, 70000, 100000) time_period <- 3 ac <- ac(actual_costs, time_period)  cv <- cv(ev, ac) cat("Cost Variance (CV):", cv, "\n") #> Cost Variance (CV): -1000

title: Earned Value (EV). — ev

title: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — grandparent_dsm
text: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM).

title: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — grandparent_dsm
code: grandparent_dsm(sm, rm)

title: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — grandparent_dsm
text: sm Resource-Task Matrix 'S' giving links (arcs) resources tasks. rm Risk-Resource Matrix 'R' giving links (arcs) risks resources.

title: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — grandparent_dsm
text: function returns Risk-based 'Grandparent' DSM 'G' giving number risks shared task.

title: Risk-based 'Grandparent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — grandparent_dsm
code:
sm <- matrix(c(1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 1), nrow = 3, ncol = 3) rm <- matrix(c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0), nrow = 2, ncol = 3) cat("Resource-Task Matrix:
") #> Resource-Task Matrix: print(sm) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    1    0    0 #> [2,]    1    1    1 #> [3,]    0    0    1 cat("
Risk-Resource Matrix:
") #>  #> Risk-Resource Matrix: print(rm) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    1    1    0 #> [2,]    1    1    0 risk_dsm <- grandparent_dsm(sm, rm) cat("
Risk-based 'Grandparent' DSM:
") #>  #> Risk-based 'Grandparent' DSM: print(risk_dsm) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    2    4    0 #> [2,]    4    8    0 #> [3,]    0    0    0

title: Monte Carlo Simulation. — mcs
text: Monte Carlo Simulation.

title: Monte Carlo Simulation. — mcs
code: mcs(num_sims, task_dists, cor_mat = NULL)

title: Monte Carlo Simulation. — mcs
text: num_sims number simulations. task_dists list lists describing task distribution. cor_mat correlation matrix tasks.

title: Monte Carlo Simulation. — mcs
text: function returns list total mean, variance, standard deviation, percentiles project.

title: Monte Carlo Simulation. — mcs
code:
num_sims <- 10000 task_dists <- list(   list(type = "normal", mean = 10, sd = 2),  # Task A: Normal distribution   list(type = "triangular", a = 5, b = 10, c = 15),  # Task B: Triangular distribution   list(type = "uniform", min = 8, max = 12)  # Task C: Uniform distribution ) cor_mat <- matrix(c(   1, 0.5, 0.3,   0.5, 1, 0.4,   0.3, 0.4, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE) results <- mcs(num_sims, task_dists, cor_mat) cat("Mean Total Duration:", results$total_mean, "
") #> Mean Total Duration: 38.59957  cat("Variance of Total Variance:", results$total_variance, "
") #> Variance of Total Variance: 19.75448  cat("Standard Deviation of Total Duration:", results$total_sd, "
") #> Standard Deviation of Total Duration: 4.444601  cat("5th Percentile:", results$percentiles[1], "
") #> 5th Percentile: 31.39155  cat("Median (50th Percentile):", results$percentiles[2], "
") #> Median (50th Percentile): 38.57252  cat("95th Percentile:", results$percentiles[3], "
") #> 95th Percentile: 46.00927  hist(results$total_distribution, breaks = 50, main = "Distribution of Total Project Duration",   xlab = "Total Duration", col = "skyblue", border = "white")

title: Resource-based 'Parent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — parent_dsm

title: Resource-based 'Parent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — parent_dsm
text: sm Resource-Task Matrix 'S' giving links (arcs) resources tasks.

title: Resource-based 'Parent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — parent_dsm
text: function returns Resource-based 'Parent' DSM 'P' giving number resources shared task.

title: Resource-based 'Parent' Design Structure Matrix (DSM). — parent_dsm
code:
sm <- matrix(c(1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 1), nrow = 3, ncol = 3) cat("Resource-Task Matrix:
") #> Resource-Task Matrix: print(sm) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    1    0    0 #> [2,]    1    1    1 #> [3,]    0    0    1 resource_dsm <- parent_dsm(sm) cat("
Resource-based 'Parent' DSM:
") #>  #> Resource-based 'Parent' DSM: print(resource_dsm) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    1    1    0 #> [2,]    1    3    1 #> [3,]    0    1    1

title: Planned Value (PV). — pv
text: Planned Value (PV).

title: Planned Value (PV). — pv
code: pv(bac, schedule, time_period)

title: Planned Value (PV). — pv
text: bac Budget Completion (total planned budget). schedule Vector planned work completion (terms percentage) time period. time_period Current time period.

title: Planned Value (PV). — pv
text: function returns Planned Value (PV) work completed.

title: Planned Value (PV). — pv
code: bac <- 100000 schedule <- c(0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.7, 1.0) time_period <- 3 pv <- pv(bac, schedule, time_period) cat("Planned Value (PV):", pv, "\n") #> Planned Value (PV): 40000

title: Sensitivity Analysis. — sensitivity
text: Sensitivity Analysis.

title: Sensitivity Analysis. — sensitivity
code: sensitivity(task_dists, cor_mat = NULL)

title: Sensitivity Analysis. — sensitivity
text: task_dists list lists describing task distribution. cor_mat correlation matrix tasks.

title: Sensitivity Analysis. — sensitivity
text: function returns vector sensitivity results respect task.

title: Sensitivity Analysis. — sensitivity
code: task_dists <- list(   list(type = "normal", mean = 10, sd = 2),  # Task A: Normal distribution   list(type = "triangular", a = 5, b = 15, c = 10),  # Task B: Triangular distribution   list(type = "uniform", min = 8, max = 12)  # Task C: Uniform distribution ) cor_mat <- matrix(c(   1, 0.5, 0.3,  0.5, 1, 0.4,   0.3, 0.4, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE) sensitivity_results <- sensitivity(task_dists, cor_mat) cat("Sensitivity of the variance in total cost with respect to the variance in each task cost:\n") #> Sensitivity of the variance in total cost with respect to the variance in each task cost: print(sensitivity_results) #> [1] 2.6 2.8 2.4

title: Second Moment Analysis. — smm
text: Second Moment Analysis.

title: Second Moment Analysis. — smm
code: smm(mean, var, cor_mat = NULL)

title: Second Moment Analysis. — smm
text: mean mean vector. var variance vector. cor_mat correlation matrix.

title: Second Moment Analysis. — smm
text: function returns list total mean, variance, standard deviation project.

title: Second Moment Analysis. — smm
code: mean <- c(10, 15, 20) var <- c(4, 9, 16) cor_mat <- matrix(c(   1, 0.5, 0.3,   0.5, 1, 0.4,   0.3, 0.4, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE) result <- smm(mean, var, cor_mat) print(result) #> $total_mean #> [1] 45 #>  #> $total_var #> [1] 49.4 #>  #> $total_std #> [1] 7.028513 #>

title: Schedule Performance Index (SPI). — spi
text: Schedule Performance Index (SPI).

title: Schedule Performance Index (SPI). — spi
code: spi(ev, pv)

title: Schedule Performance Index (SPI). — spi
text: ev Earned Value. pv Planned Value.

title: Schedule Performance Index (SPI). — spi
text: function returns Schedule Performance Index (SPI) work completed.

title: Schedule Performance Index (SPI). — spi
code: bac <- 100000 schedule <- c(0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.7, 1.0) time_period <- 3 pv <- pv(bac, schedule, time_period) actual_per_complete <- 0.35 ev <- ev(bac, actual_per_complete)  spi <- spi(ev, pv) cat("Schedule Performance Index (SPI):", spi, "\n") #> Schedule Performance Index (SPI): 0.875

code: bac <- 100000 schedule <- c(0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.7, 1.0) time_period <- 3 pv <- pv(bac, schedule, time_period) actual_per_complete <- 0.35 ev <- ev(bac, actual_per_complete)  sv <- sv(ev, pv) cat("Schedule Variance (SV):", sv, "\n") #> Schedule Variance (SV): -5000
